title: @Meddler If you're going to nerf MF, can you please not gut her AP playstyle?
body:
On the PBE, Make it Rain is being reduced to 80/115/150/185/220 from 90/145/200/225/310. Now, I don't want to talk about whether AD MF needs nerfs. That's not the issue. I just want to point out the fact that in her rework, riot specifically mentioned that they took pains to make sure that AP was preserved. I know it doesn't seem like much, but the AP playstyle is fun and rewarding. If you don't believe me, try it; it feels very different from AD MF, and is extremely fun to play. This nerf absolutely slaughters the AP playstyle, hurting it WAY more than it hurts the AD playstyle. There are an infinite number of ways you could avoid this (Nerf Love Tap instead, nerf the AD ratio on her ult, increase the AP ratio on her Q and E to compensate, nerf her attack speed on her W instead, etc). Please, give at least a smidgen of thought to the AP playstyle before you gut it in a nerf that's barely going to affact AD miss fortune (people will just level W first instead, E damage was pretty negligable by end game anyway).

*Edit: Wow, the community is feeling toxic  tonight.

Honestly, I think the nerf is in the wrong direction. Miss Fortune needs a nerf, yes, but... She needs the range on Make It Rain reduced back to 800 (they buffed it to 1000 when preseason started)

 That, and they need to revert the windup reduction they gave Bullet Time. Currently it casts instantly, which was healthy before when Bullet Time wasn't that powerful to begin with. Now, it's a catastrophe to enemy teams. The damage is devastating, the length, the width, which is all fine because it's a ***3*** second channel that cannot be redirected, can be interrupted and dodged. But, with the windup time basically gone, enemy teams have minimal time to react to it, especially when a long ranged Make It Rain is dropped on the enemy team.

TL;DR - Revert the buff to Make It Rain's range, and revert the buff to the ***significant*** reduction of Bullet Time's windup time, making it cast immediately.

An alternative is to increase the mana cost of Make it rain to 100, which will force MF's to think twice before they use it. 


As for the ultimate, a wind time for a 3 second long channel is unnecessary IMO, just try to step out of it or end the channel. Perhaps a slight reduction of the AD ratio will be fine.

There's nothing wrong with keeping side builds viable, but that is much less important than properly balancing the champion around their main role, and this is definitely one of the best options for balancing AD MF. Right now, she's maxing E in lane, and getting very favorable trades with instant thunderlord's procs on an ability that is extremely easy to hit. She's not making any major use of the Q bounce, which is what Riot really, really wanted to design her around (at least for lane). That's a problem, and it has to be addressed. This is the best way to address it.

None of the nerfs you suggest address the problem anywhere near as well as this nerf, and it's not worth messing up the main balance of the champion to preserve a much, much rarer side build.

The one suggestion that has potential is the AP ratio increases. That might be an option worth pursing, and there is probably no harm in looking into it. Then again, I can't honestly say that I really care one way or the other if Riot does or doesn't help her, so good luck with that I guess.
